IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE AFFORDABLE FACULTY AND STAFF HOUSING ON THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA IRVINE CAMPUS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE ORGANIZATION WAS CREATED BY THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA FOR THE PURPOSE OF FOSTERING AND ENCOURAGING THE DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF AFFORDABLE FACULTY AND STAFF HOUSING ON THE CAMPUS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA, IRVINE. THE ORGANIZATION IS A SEC. 509(A)(3) SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION TO THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA, IRVINE.
IRS990.Description: THE IRVINE CAMPUS HOUSING AUTHORITY DEVELOPS AND MAINTAINS AFFORDABLE HOUSING AND RELATED FACILITIES FOR THE USE OF FACULTY AND STAFF OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA, IRVINE.

OtherLiabilities.Description: PREMIUM ON NOTE PAYABLE TO THE UC REGENTS

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ACCORDING TO OUR BYLAWS, ALL DIRECTORS OF THE CORPORATION SHALL BE APPOINTED BY THE CHANCELLOR OF UCI, WITH THE APPROVAL OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Audit Committee shall have the responsibility for reviewing the organization's Form 990 (including all pertinent Schedules) before it is filed with the Internal Revenue Service. -A draft of the Form 990 should be ready for review by the Audit Committee no later than one month prior to the filing deadline. -In conducting their review of the draft of the Form 990, it is preferred that the Audit Committee shall conduct a top-level or big-picture type of review. However, if the Audit Committee desires or deems it necessary to conduct a more detailed review of the Form 990, then they should contact the preparer of the Form 990 to request copies of the relevant detailed tax return workpapers which they would like to see. -Following the review of the Form 990 by the Audit Committee and the filing of the form with the Internal Revenue Service, the Audit Committee shall inform the Board that the form has been reviewed and filed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All employees are required to sign our employee handbook which contains our conflict of interest policy.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Changes in salaries and other compensation for all ICHA senior managers are determined on an annual (calendar year) basis by the full Board of Directors in consultation with the Compensation and Benefits committee consisting of four Board members none of whom have any financial interest in the outcome of the determination. -In addition, salary reviews have been conducted in consultation with human resource managers at UC Irvine to determine whether ICHA compensation is consistent with compensation levels at UC Irvine for comparable responsibilities. Where inconsistencies exist, the Board considers action designed to bring salary and benefits in line with the Campus. Current salary levels for all senior managers including the President of ICHA are generally consistent with salaries levels at the UC Irvine Campus for comparable functional areas. Additionally, annual salary increases have generally been consistent with annual salary increases at UC Irvine which is the institution ICHA serves by providing housing for its faculty and staff.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The following documents of the TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION are available for inspection at the organization's main office during normal business hours: Tax Exemption Application (Form 1023), Internal Revenue Service Determination Letter, Articles of Incorporation, By-Laws, and Audited financial statements. -The public inspection copy of the organization's Form 990 from the previous three years (at a minimum), will be available for inspection at the organization's main office during normal business hours. -When responding to a public inspection request for any organizational document or Form 990 by anyone, the organization shall fulfill such request in a timely fashion without inquiring as to the reason for the public inspection request.

The Audit Committee reviews and approves all audit activity, up to and including tax returns. The Audit Committee receives, reviews, and responds to information, inquiries, and reports from the auditors and confers with them regarding the Corporation's financial affairs as requested by the audit firm. The Audit Committee advises the Board regarding the presentation and the acceptance of the annual audit report and Form 990.
